content.text:
**One thing I'd love feedback on: module deprecation.** Every resource I can find insists that when renaming a module you should deprecate *all* prior versions. I originally followed this advice, but the more I think about it the sillier this seems.

For example, `ssb-db@10.0.0` doesn't exist, so it seems strange that we'd be showing the deprecation notice to people installing `secure-scuttlebutt@10.0.0`. If they try to `npm install ssb-db@10.0.0` it will fail, which makes me think that we should *only* deprecate the latest version. **Are there any compelling reasons to deprecate all versions, or is it fine to just deprecate the latest version?**
